Instance.description: Allow a test set to be referenced. This is a full test set that is reference-able in OE, allowing a test set to be a single entry in a test set. Unlike the rest of the test variants, which are instantiated at time of use, this one is still a class at the time of use. This is why we're using __new__(). This allows us to call this like a function and still get the desired results.

TunableVariant.name: invert_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the results of running the test(s) will be negated

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Properties that are only used if the results of the test are inverted

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the provided tooltip will be the failure message in the case where the test set passes, but inversion is enabled, so the end result is failure. We do not propagate a tooltip when tests pass, only failed tests

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Tooltip to show when a test passes, but has been inverted to fail

TdescFragTag.name: test
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs
